config_defs.name: authentication.method
config_defs.documentation: Select how you want to authenticate with BigQuery.

config_defs.name: keyfile
config_defs.documentation: GCP service account JSON file with write permissions for BigQuery.

config_defs.name: oauth.client.id
config_defs.documentation: Client ID of your Google OAuth application.

config_defs.name: oauth.client.secret
config_defs.documentation: Client secret of your Google OAuth application.

config_defs.name: oauth.auth.button
config_defs.documentation: Initiates the OAuth authentication flow.

config_defs.name: oauth.refresh.token
config_defs.documentation: OAuth 2.0 refresh token for BigQuery.

config_defs.name: oauth.auth.endpoint
config_defs.documentation: GCP OAuth 2.0 Auth Endpoint.

config_defs.name: oauth.token.endpoint
config_defs.documentation: GCP OAuth 2.0 Token Endpoint.

config_defs.name: oauth.client.auth.mode
config_defs.documentation: Client authorization mode i.e. via RequestBody or Basic Auth Header.

config_defs.name: oauth.scopes
config_defs.documentation: BigQuery Storage Write API OAuth 2.0 Scopes.

config_defs.name: oauth.query.params
config_defs.documentation: BigQuery OAuth query parameters.

config_defs.name: oauth.session.id
config_defs.documentation: Connect OAuth Session ID.

config_defs.name: oauth.use.shared.app
config_defs.documentation: Whether to use shared app.

config_defs.name: oauth.config.map
config_defs.documentation: Connect OAuth Config Map to map OAuth API parameters to ConfigDefs.

config_defs.name: project
config_defs.documentation: ID for the GCP project where BigQuery is located.

config_defs.name: datasets
config_defs.documentation: Name of the BigQuery dataset where table(s) is located.

config_defs.name: ingestion.mode
config_defs.documentation: Select a mode to ingest data into the table. Select STREAMING for reduced latency. Select BATCH LOADING for cost savings. Select UPSERT for upserting records. Select UPSERT_DELETE for upserting and deleting records.

config_defs.name: input.data.format
config_defs.documentation: Sets the input Kafka record value format. Valid entries are AVRO, JSON_SR, PROTOBUF, and JSON. Note that you need to have Confluent Cloud Schema Registry configured if using a schema-based message format like AVRO, JSON_SR, or PROTOBUF.

config_defs.name: input.key.format
config_defs.documentation: Sets the input Kafka record key format. Valid entries are AVRO, BYTES, JSON, JSON_SR, PROTOBUF. Note that you need to have Confluent Cloud Schema Registry configured if using a schema-based message format like AVRO, JSON_SR, and PROTOBUF

config_defs.name: commit.interval
config_defs.documentation: The interval, in seconds, the connector attempts to commit streamed records. Set the interval between 60 seconds (1 minute) and 14,400 seconds (4 hours). Be careful when setting the commit interval as on every commit interval, a task calls the ``CreateWriteStream`` API which is subject to a `quota <https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/quotas#write-api-limits:~:text=handle%20unexpected%20demand.-,CreateWriteStream,-requests>`. For example, if you have five tasks (may belong to different connectors also) set to commit every 60 seconds to a project, there will be five calls to ``CreateWriteStream`` API on that project every minute. If the count exceeds the allowed quota, some tasks may fail.

config_defs.name: topic2table.map
config_defs.display_name: Kafka Topic to BigQuery Table Map
config_defs.documentation: Map of topics to tables (optional). The required format is comma-separated tuples. For example, <topic-1>:<table-1>,<topic-2>:<table-2>,... Note that a topic name must not be modified using a regex SMT while using this option. If this property is used, ``sanitize.topics`` is ignored. Also, if the topic-to-table map doesn't contain the topic for a record, the connector creates a table with the same name as the topic name.

config_defs.name: sanitize.topics
config_defs.documentation: Designates whether to automatically sanitize topic names before using them as table names in BigQuery. If not enabled, topic names are used as table names.

config_defs.name: sanitize.field.names
config_defs.documentation: Whether to automatically sanitize field names before using them as field names in BigQuery. BigQuery specifies that field names can only contain letters, numbers, and underscores. The sanitizer replaces invalid symbols with underscores. If the field name starts with a digit, the sanitizer adds an underscore in front of field name. Caution: Key duplication errors can occur if different fields are named a.b and a_b, for instance. After being sanitized, field names a.b and a_b will have same value.

config_defs.name: sanitize.field.names.in.array
config_defs.documentation: Whether to automatically sanitize field names inside arrays. When enabled, field names inside arrays will also be sanitized according to BigQuery naming rules. This setting only takes effect if 'sanitize.field.names' is also enabled.

config_defs.name: auto.update.schemas
config_defs.documentation: Designates whether or not to automatically update BigQuery schemas. New fields in record schemas must be nullable. Note: Supports AVRO, JSON_SR, and PROTOBUF message format only.

config_defs.name: auto.create.tables
config_defs.documentation: Designates whether or not to automatically create BigQuery tables. Note: Supports AVRO, JSON_SR, and PROTOBUF message format only.

config_defs.name: partitioning.type
config_defs.documentation: The time partitioning type to use when creating new partitioned tables. Existing tables will not be altered to use this partitioning type.

config_defs.name: timestamp.partition.field.name
config_defs.documentation: The name of the field in the value that contains the timestamp to partition by in BigQuery. This also enables timestamp partitioning for each table.

config_defs.name: use.date.time.formatter
config_defs.documentation: Specify whether to use a ``DateTimeFormatter`` to support a wide range of epochs. Setting this true will use ``DateTimeFormatter`` over default ``SimpleDateFormat``. The output might vary for same input between the two formatters.

config_defs.name: topic2clustering.fields.map
config_defs.display_name: Kafka Topic to Clustering Fields Map
config_defs.documentation: Maps topics to their corresponding table clustering fields (optional). Format: comma-separated tuples, e.g., topic1:[col1|col2], topic2:[col1|col2|..], ... Specifies the fields used to cluster data in BigQuery. The order of the fields determines the clustering precedence.

config_defs.name: use.integer.for.int8.int16
config_defs.display_name: Use INTEGER for INT8 and INT16
config_defs.documentation: Determines how the connector stores INT8 (BYTE) and INT16 (SHORT) data types in BigQuery during auto table creation and schema update. When set to ``false``(default), these values are stored as FLOAT. When set to ``true``, INT8 (BYTE) and INT16 (SHORT) values are stored as INTEGER.

config_defs.name: connector.class
config_defs.group: How should we connect to your data?

config_defs.name: name
config_defs.group: How should we connect to your data?
config_defs.documentation: Sets a name for your connector.

config_defs.name: tasks.max
config_defs.group: Number of tasks for this connector
config_defs.documentation: Maximum number of tasks for the connector.

config_defs.name: kafka.auth.mode
config_defs.documentation: Kafka Authentication mode. It can be one of KAFKA_API_KEY or SERVICE_ACCOUNT. It defaults to KAFKA_API_KEY mode.

config_defs.name: kafka.api.key
config_defs.documentation: Kafka API Key. Required when kafka.auth.mode==KAFKA_API_KEY.

connector_configs.name: confluent.topic.bootstrap.servers
connector_configs.value: Placeholder value to pass connector validations

config_defs.name: kafka.service.account.id
config_defs.documentation: The Service Account that will be used to generate the API keys to communicate with Kafka Cluster.

config_defs.name: kafka.api.secret
config_defs.documentation: Secret associated with Kafka API key. Required when kafka.auth.mode==KAFKA_API_KEY.

config_defs.name: topics
config_defs.group: Which topics do you want to get data from?
config_defs.documentation: Identifies the topic name or a comma-separated list of topic names.

config_defs.name: max.poll.interval.ms
config_defs.documentation: The maximum delay between subsequent consume requests to Kafka. This configuration property may be used to improve the performance of the connector, if the connector cannot send records to the sink system. Defaults to 300000 milliseconds (5 minutes).

config_defs.name: max.poll.records
config_defs.documentation: The maximum number of records to consume from Kafka in a single request. This configuration property may be used to improve the performance of the connector, if the connector cannot send records to the sink system. Defaults to 500 records.

config_defs.name: errors.tolerance
config_defs.documentation: Use this property if you would like to configure the connector's error handling behavior. WARNING: This property should be used with CAUTION for SOURCE CONNECTORS as it may lead to dataloss. If you set this property to 'all', the connector will not fail on errant records, but will instead log them (and send to DLQ for Sink Connectors) and continue processing. If you set this property to 'none', the connector task will fail on errant records.

config_defs.name: errors.deadletterqueue.topic.name
config_defs.group: Which topics do you want to get data from?
config_defs.documentation: The name of the topic to be used as the dead letter queue (DLQ) for messages that result in an error when processed by this sink connector, or its transformations or converters. Defaults to 'dlq-${connector}' if not set. The DLQ topic will be created automatically if it does not exist. You can provide ``${connector}`` in the value to use it as a placeholder for the logical cluster ID.

config_defs.name: csfle.enabled
config_defs.documentation: Determines whether the connector honours CSFLE rules or not

config_defs.name: csfle.onFailure
config_defs.display_name: Connector behaviour on data decryption failure
config_defs.documentation: Configures the behavior for decryption failures. If set to ERROR, the connector will behave as configured for error behaviour. If set to NONE, the connector will ignore the decryption failure and proceed to write the data in its encrypted form.

config_defs.name: sr.service.account.id
config_defs.documentation: Select the service account that has appropriate permissions to schemas and encryption keys in the Schema Registry.

config_defs.name: schema.context.name
config_defs.documentation: Add a schema context name. A schema context represents an independent scope in Schema Registry. It is a separate sub-schema tied to topics in different Kafka clusters that share the same Schema Registry instance. If not used, the connector uses the default schema configured for Schema Registry in your Confluent Cloud environment.

config_defs.name: input.data.format
config_defs.documentation: Sets the input Kafka record value format. Valid entries are AVRO, JSON_SR, PROTOBUF, JSON or BYTES. Note that you need to have Confluent Cloud Schema Registry configured if using a schema-based message format like AVRO, JSON_SR, and PROTOBUF.

config_defs.name: value.converter.schemas.enable
config_defs.documentation: Include schemas within each of the serialized values. Input messages must contain `schema` and `payload` fields and may not contain additional fields. For plain JSON data, set this to `false`. Applicable for JSON Converter.

config_defs.name: value.converter.replace.null.with.default
config_defs.documentation: Whether to replace fields that have a default value and that are null to the default value. When set to true, the default value is used, otherwise null is used. Applicable for JSON Converter.

config_defs.name: value.converter.ignore.default.for.nullables
config_defs.documentation: When set to true, this property ensures that the corresponding record in Kafka is NULL, instead of showing the default column value. Applicable for AVRO,PROTOBUF and JSON_SR Converters.

config_defs.name: value.converter.scrub.invalid.names
config_defs.documentation: Whether to scrub invalid names by replacing invalid characters with valid characters. Applicable for Avro and Protobuf Converters.

config_defs.name: input.key.format
config_defs.documentation: Sets the input Kafka record key format. Valid entries are AVRO, BYTES, JSON, JSON_SR, PROTOBUF, or STRING. Note that you need to have Confluent Cloud Schema Registry configured if using a schema-based message format like AVRO, JSON_SR, and PROTOBUF

config_defs.name: key.converter.schemas.enable
config_defs.documentation: Include schemas within each of the serialized keys. Input message keys must contain `schema` and `payload` fields and may not contain additional fields. For plain JSON data, set this to `false`. Applicable for JSON Key Converter.

config_defs.name: key.converter.replace.null.with.default
config_defs.documentation: Whether to replace fields that have a default value and that are null to the default value. When set to true, the default value is used, otherwise null is used. Applicable for JSON Key Converter.

config_defs.name: auto.restart.on.user.error
config_defs.documentation: Enable connector to automatically restart on user-actionable errors.

config_defs.name: value.converter.enhanced.avro.schema.support
config_defs.documentation: Enable enhanced schema support to preserve package information and Enums. Applicable for Avro Converters.

config_defs.name: value.converter.connect.meta.data
config_defs.documentation: Allow the Connect converter to add its metadata to the output schema. Applicable for Avro Converters.

config_defs.name: value.converter.enhanced.protobuf.schema.support
config_defs.documentation: Enable enhanced schema support to preserve package information. Applicable for Protobuf Converters.

config_defs.name: value.converter.generate.index.for.unions
config_defs.documentation: Whether to generate an index suffix for unions. Applicable for Protobuf Converters.

config_defs.name: value.converter.int.for.enums
config_defs.documentation: Whether to represent enums as integers. Applicable for Protobuf Converters.

config_defs.name: value.converter.optional.for.nullables
config_defs.documentation: Whether nullable fields should be specified with an optional label. Applicable for Protobuf Converters.

config_defs.name: value.converter.generate.struct.for.nulls
config_defs.documentation: Whether to generate a struct variable for null values. Applicable for Protobuf Converters.

config_defs.name: value.converter.wrapper.for.nullables
config_defs.documentation: Whether nullable fields should use primitive wrapper messages. Applicable for Protobuf Converters.

config_defs.name: value.converter.wrapper.for.raw.primitives
config_defs.documentation: Whether a wrapper message should be interpreted as a raw primitive at root level. Applicable for Protobuf Converters.

config_defs.name: value.converter.object.additional.properties
config_defs.documentation: Whether to allow additional properties for object schemas. Applicable for JSON_SR Converters.

config_defs.name: value.converter.use.optional.for.nonrequired
config_defs.documentation: Whether to set non-required properties to be optional. Applicable for JSON_SR Converters.

config_defs.name: value.converter.decimal.format
config_defs.documentation:
Specify the JSON/JSON_SR serialization format for Connect DECIMAL logical type values with two allowed literals:
BASE64 to serialize DECIMAL logical types as base64 encoded binary data and
NUMERIC to serialize Connect DECIMAL logical type values in JSON/JSON_SR as a number representing the decimal value.

config_defs.name: value.converter.auto.register.schemas
config_defs.documentation: Specify if the Serializer should attempt to register the Schema.

config_defs.name: value.converter.use.latest.version
config_defs.documentation: Use latest version of schema in subject for serialization when auto.register.schemas is false.

config_defs.name: value.converter.latest.compatibility.strict
config_defs.documentation: Verify latest subject version is backward compatible when `use.latest.version` is `true`.

config_defs.name: key.converter.key.subject.name.strategy
config_defs.documentation: How to construct the subject name for key schema registration.

config_defs.name: value.converter.value.subject.name.strategy
config_defs.documentation: Determines how to construct the subject name under which the value schema is registered with Schema Registry.

config_defs.name: value.converter.reference.subject.name.strategy
config_defs.documentation: Set the subject reference name strategy for value. Valid entries are DefaultReferenceSubjectNameStrategy or QualifiedReferenceSubjectNameStrategy. Note that the subject reference name strategy can be selected only for PROTOBUF format with the default strategy being DefaultReferenceSubjectNameStrategy.

config_defs.name: value.converter.allow.optional.map.keys
config_defs.documentation: Allow optional string map key when converting from Connect Schema to Avro Schema. Applicable for Avro Converters.

config_defs.name: value.converter.flatten.singleton.unions
config_defs.documentation: Whether to flatten singleton unions. Applicable for Avro and JSON_SR Converters.

config_defs.name: value.converter.optional.for.proto2
config_defs.documentation: Whether proto2 optionals are supported. Applicable for Protobuf Converters.

config_defs.name: value.converter.flatten.unions
config_defs.documentation: Whether to flatten unions (oneofs). Applicable for Protobuf Converters.

config_defs.name: header.converter
config_defs.documentation: The converter class for the headers. This is used to serialize and deserialize the headers of the messages.

config_defs.name: consumer.override.auto.offset.reset
config_defs.documentation: Defines the behavior of the consumer when there is no committed position (which occurs when the group is first initialized) or when an offset is out of range. You can choose either to reset the position to the earliest offset (the default) or the latest offset. You can also select none if you would rather set the initial offset yourself and you are willing to handle out of range errors manually. More details: https://docs.confluent.io/platform/current/installation/configuration/consumer-configs.html#auto-offset-reset

config_defs.name: consumer.override.isolation.level
config_defs.documentation: Controls how to read messages written transactionally. If set to read_committed, consumer.poll() will only return transactional messages which have been committed. If set to read_uncommitted (the default), consumer.poll() will return all messages, even transactional messages which have been aborted. Non-transactional messages will be returned unconditionally in either mode.  More details: https://docs.confluent.io/platform/current/installation/configuration/consumer-configs.html#isolation-level

config_defs.name: topics.regex
config_defs.group: Which topics do you want to get data from?
config_defs.documentation: A regular expression that matches the names of the topics to consume from. This is useful when you want to consume from multiple topics that match a certain pattern without having to list them all individually.
